instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.CHGR_DCIN: What is CHGR_DCIN? CHGR_DCIN comes directly from charger into ISL6258 or ISL6259, the resistor before it can be blown when there are surges. Should be checked when PPBUS_G3H is missing.
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> voltage drop <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hey,

I'm working on a MBP (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) with fluctuating voltage on PPBUS. When I plug it in I got 12V for a moment, slowly dropping to 0.4V.
I got a green light on the charger, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is stable.
<SIGNAL>CHGR_DCIN</SIGNAL> is okay
<SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_L</SIGNAL> is okay.
Current sening seems okay.
I already replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and removed F7140 with the same result.

Thank you for your help.
Dudi

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> voltage drop <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Any history fault?
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Replace <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>, just in case.
Also check R/C network from pins 5, 7, 8.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> voltage drop <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Don't know much about this board - some corrosion around  <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3310</CHIP> - but nothing too bad. 

I changed <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>.
Measurements on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>:
Pin 1: 0.04V
Pin 2: 18.3V
Pin 3: 4.4V
Pin 9: 0.3V
Pin 12: 0V <- PP3V42 is present at other points - maybe a broken trace?
Pin 14: 3.4V
Pin 15: 0.02V
Pin 17: 0.02V
Pin 19: 5.47V
Pin 20: 5.48V
Pin 27: 18.3V

Pin 5, 7 and 8: single pulse when plugging in

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> voltage drop <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Solve the problem with broken trace first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> voltage drop <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Resorting the broken trace worked - ppbus was stable then. Had a problem with backlight data line too because of another broken trace but now everything works fine - thank you! :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> voltage drop <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
